meanings.definition: To move or spread out in a scattered fashion.
meanings.sent1: The children were straggling behind on the nature walk.
meanings.sent2: The hikers straggling along the trail enjoyed the peaceful scenery.
meanings.sent3: The ants were straggling in a line, each going their own way.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the sky seemed to be straggling across the vast darkness.
meanings.sent5: The fallen leaves were straggling across the yard after the windstorm.

meanings.definition: To trail behind or wander away from a group.
meanings.sent1: The tired puppy was straggling behind the rest of the litter.
meanings.sent2: The lost child was straggling in the crowded mall, looking for their parents.
meanings.sent3: The stray cat was straggling around the neighborhood, searching for food.
meanings.sent4: The old car was straggling along the highway, struggling to keep up with traffic.
meanings.sent5: The student was straggling behind in the race, trying to catch up with the others.

meanings.definition: Occurring irregularly or in a scattered manner.
meanings.sent1: The straggling clouds in the sky created a beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent2: The straggling bushes in the garden gave it a wild and untamed look.
meanings.sent3: The straggling schedule of the event confused the attendees.
meanings.sent4: The straggling pattern of stars in the sky formed a unique constellation.
meanings.sent5: The straggling arrangement of books on the shelf made it look messy.
